page.title: 01Offord Cluny, Huntingdon.
page.content: Our land is mainly rural, low lying, with many drains & ditches. The {Great Ouse}flows south to north.The flood plain provides rich water meadows for feeding cattle. The main industry is gravel extraction _ 400 acres of active gravel pits. A further 100 acres of disused gravel pits is now used by Huntingdon Refuse Disposal Ltd. as a private tip. Other disused pits are used by The London Angling Association for fishing.Small Industry is thriving,some expanding.{Offord {Cluny,}is the only village.It has 1 manor house, 1 church & an antique shop, a few houses & no school, food shop or post office. The A 141 runs from Brampton to the A 1.The railway runs from London to Edinburgh.The line is being electrified.Local leisure activities are boating, canoeing, shooting, fishing, and riding.
